title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 11 February 2016 - XWiki
content:
<sorinello\_> has joined #xwiki  
00:28 <sorinello> has quit  
00:40 <abusenius> has quit  
00:58 <iamchrisf> has quit  
04:20 <sorinello\_> has quit  
04:20 <sorinello\_> has joined #xwiki  
04:21 <sorinello\_> is now known as <sorinello>  
04:21 <sorinello> has quit  
04:32 <sorinello> has joined #xwiki  
05:53 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:16 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:03 <cjd> has quit  
08:06 <mflorea> has quit  
08:12 <woshilapin> has quit  
08:14 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:16 <acotiuga> has joined #xwiki  
08:25 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <acotiuga> Hello! I would like to add a new application (Forum) to be translated on http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Contrib/WebHome.  I can't find any "Add new application" button. What would be the procedure for this?  
08:39 <vmassol> good morning  
08:40 <vmassol> checking (I don't know l10n)  
08:41 <vmassol> acotiuga: are you logged in?  
08:41 <vmassol> can you see the form on http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Contrib/WebHome ?  
08:41 <acotiuga> yes I am  
08:41 <vmassol> (bottom)  
08:41 <acotiuga> No  
08:41 <acotiuga> The only form I see is the comment one  
08:42 <vmassol> ok then we probably don't allow it  
08:42 <vmassol> let me create it  
08:42 <acotiuga> ok, thanks  
08:42 <vmassol> yep  
08:42 <vmassol> #if ($hasAdmin)  
08:42 <vmassol> :)  
08:43 <acotiuga> #else  
08:43 <acotiuga> :(  
08:43 <acotiuga> #end  
08:44 <vmassol> done  
08:44 <vmassol> :)  
08:45 <vmassol> wait  
08:45 <vmassol> I need to import it  
08:50 <vmassol> cleaning spam, sorry  
08:52 <vmassol> good morning everyone  
08:53 <vmassol> btw lots of revisions on this page: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/XWiki/XWikiAllGroup?viewer=history&showminor=false&firstIndex=0 (and probably wrongly associated to Guillaume). I thought we had implicit groups on xwiki.org but apparently not. WDYT about setting it up?  
08:54 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:54 <vmassol> still reloading l10n I think acotiuga  
08:54 <vmassol> I probably reloaded too much  
08:54 <vmassol> (it takes time)  
08:55 <vmassol> ok seems it's full now with 163 translatiosn :)  
08:55 <vmassol> but the reloading must still be happening as the wiki is slow...  
09:06 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:16 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:23 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:40 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki

09:49 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:55 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
10:08 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
11:52 <Denis> has quit  
12:03 <acotiuga> has quit  
12:42 <D-Spair> has quit  
12:46 <msmeria1> has joined #xwiki  
12:47 <msmeria> has quit  
12:48 <D-Spair> has joined #xwiki  
12:48 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:58 <mflorea> has quit  
14:44 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
14:45 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
14:46 <msmeria1> has quit  
14:50 <vmassol> mflorea: do we have doc for adding a plugin to our wysiwyg editor? I googled and can't find it  
14:51 <vmassol> just found http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/WysiwygEditor  
14:52 <mflorea> vmassol: if by adding you mean enabling it then yes, that's the doc  
14:52 <vmassol> I mean developing  
14:52 <vmassol> one  
14:52 <vmassol> (trying to answer to a user)  
14:53 <mflorea> ah, then no, there's no doc because it's not that easy, you can't do it outside of the GWT code of the editor  
14:54 <mflorea> you would have to recompile the editor  
14:54 <vmassol> ok I'll reply that it's complex and that we're transitioning to ck  
14:54 <mflorea> in other words, the GWT-based WYSIWYG editor doesn't have real plugins, since you cannot really plug new code  
14:56 <mflorea> vmassol: http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-9249  
14:58 <mflorea> there is some design linked http://design.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Design/WYSIWYGPluginInterface but it wasn't finished. Unfortunately I didn't had enough time to help Josef Haimerl on this :(  
14:58 <vmassol> can we close it?  
14:58 <vmassol> :)  
14:58 <vmassol> with won't fix now that we've agreed that the future is CK?  
14:58 <mflorea> sure, but after we integrate CK  
14:58 <vmassol> well  
14:58 <vmassol> I wouldn't want anyone to start spending time on this  
14:58 <mflorea> ah, I see  
14:58 <mflorea> then yes  
14:59 <vmassol> ok I'll close it with some explanatios  
14:59 <vmassol> thanks  
14:59 <mflorea> thanks  
14:59 <vmassol> that will also start moving people in the right direcdtion  
14:59 <vmassol> (in their understanding of where we want to go)  
15:00 <Trefex> hey  
15:00 <Trefex> why is 8.0-M1 in the stable branch?  
15:00 <vmassol> btw mflorea when will we be able to bundle the CKeditor integration in the distribution?  
15:00 <Trefex> i just deployed it in my production system that was running 7-3  
15:00 <Trefex> 7.3\*  
15:00 <vmassol> mflorea: 8.0 or 8.1?  
15:00 <mflorea> 8.1  
15:00 <vmassol> k  
15:01 <Trefex> do i have to roll back or is it safe to go from 7.3 to 8.0-M1 directly?  
15:01 <vmassol> mflorea: any risk that CKeditor will come short for our needs?  
15:01 <Trefex> and is it even recommended to use 8.0 in production ?  
15:01 <vmassol> or aer we beyond that now?  
15:01 <mflorea> I'm focused on implementing the missing features now while keeping it as an extension to be able to use it on older version. but starting with 8.1 it should be bundled in XWiki by default  
15:01 <vmassol> ie can there still be a blocker?  
15:02 <vmassol> are we sure we won't have to backtrack?  
15:02 <Trefex> that's a serious bug for me  
15:03 <vmassol> Trefex: wdym? where did you see that it's stable?  
15:03 <vmassol> on http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download it says "development  
15:03 <vmassol> "  
15:03 <Trefex> yes so why is it available here? deb http://maven.xwiki.org stable/  
15:03 <vmassol> no idea about that, tmortagne should know more  
15:04 <Trefex> i specifically added the stable repo to have stable releases  
15:04 <mflorea> vmassol: I haven't experienced any serious issues so far so. The CKEditor code is written and documented very well.  
15:04 <Trefex> now i screwed up my prod system  
15:04 <vmassol> ok cool  
15:04 <vmassol> (not for you Trefex ;))  
15:04 <Trefex> vmassol: i guessed so :D  
15:04 <vmassol> that said 8.0M1 should be pretty stable IMO  
15:04 <tmortagne> Trefex: if you get milestone in stable repository it's definitely a bug yes  
15:04 <Trefex> http://maven.xwiki.org/stable/Packages  
15:04 <tmortagne> will check it  
15:05 <Trefex> vmassol: can i go straight from 7.3 to 8?  
15:05 <vmassol> 8.0M1 is not very different from 7.4.1  
15:05 <vmassol> very similar  
15:05 <tmortagne> upgrading from 7.3 to 8 is not an issue yes, but yes milestone have nothing to do in this repository  
15:05 <vmassol> we ahven't done any big change yet in 8.0  
15:06 <Trefex> vmassol: i see  
15:06 <vmassol> the major change that will happen in 8.0M2 is probabmy the need for java 8  
15:06 <Trefex> but if you remove now the package from the stable repo, then it will screw up my apt again i guess  
15:06 <vmassol> but 8.0M1 just required java 7  
15:06 <Trefex> so i guess i can roll back and upgrade to 7.4.1 ?  
15:06 <tmortagne> I recently changed the filter for stable version, I must have broke something  
15:06 <tmortagne> I doubt apt-get will upgrade you install with an older package  
15:07 <Trefex> ok  
15:07 <tmortagne> so removing 8.0M1 from the repository should not change anything for you  
15:08 <vmassol> Enygma`: btw would be good to start again the BFDs, no?  
15:08 <Trefex> in the 8.0-M1 xwiki.cfg it wants to remove -  com.xpn.xwiki.plugin.charts.ChartingPlugin,\  
15:08 <Trefex> is it something that dissapeared ?  
15:08 <vmassol> been moved out  
15:08 <vmassol> was deprecated and not used a long time ago  
15:09 <Trefex> ok, i'll manually remove it  
15:09 <vmassol> yes  
15:09 <Trefex> don't want the other settings to be over-written  
15:10 <Trefex> everytime a surprise when i upgrade :D  
15:10 <Trefex> at least i got my stickers from FOSDEM  
15:11 <tmortagne> hmm the regexp is wrong indeed  
15:11 <tmortagne> must find a better one  
15:11 \* Trefex slaps around :D  
15:11 <msmeria> has quit  
15:11 <vmassol> sorry about that Trefex...  
15:11 <vmassol> sad to see you're hitting problems all the time  
15:12 <Trefex> hahaha  
15:12 <Trefex> why else am I here?  
15:12 <vmassol> :)  
15:12 <vmassol> to tell us how much you love xwiki? :)  
15:12 <Trefex> i do actually  
15:12 <vmassol> cool  
15:12 <Trefex> otherwise i wouldn't put up with it :P  
15:13 <vmassol> https://twitter.com/XWiki/status/697342657383821313  
15:13 <vmassol> :)  
15:13 <Trefex> bad time to ask for feedback  
15:13 <vmassol> yeah  
15:13 <vmassol> just fill it when you fall in love with xwiki again  
15:14 <Trefex> http://imgur.com/uwsDsFU  
15:15 <vmassol> nice!!!  
15:15 <vmassol> too bad I wasn't there at fosdem, would have been nice to meet you...  
15:15 <Trefex> indeed i was asking for you :)  
15:15 <Trefex> and tmortagne too  
15:15 <vmassol> and we can see our chat on your picture!  
15:15 <vmassol> (this irc chat)  
15:15 <Trefex> ya, it's real-time  
15:15 <tmortagne> yea I don't go to fosdem inough...  
15:16 <Trefex> sort of like showing today's newspaper  
15:16 <tmortagne> enough  
15:16 <vmassol> can I tweet it? or maybe you wish to?  
15:16 <Trefex> oh i can, you can re-tweet if you likle  
15:16 <vmassol> ok cool will do  
15:17 <Trefex> maybe i should first successfully upgrade :P  
15:17 <vmassol> nah do it first  
15:17 <vmassol> or you won't do it at all :)  
15:18 <Trefex> how do i embed a pic on twitter, mhhh  
15:18 <vmassol> I have an add image button in tweetdeck  
15:19 <vmassol> on twitter.com too  
15:19 <vmassol> there's a button when you add a tweet  
15:21 <tmortagne> stable repository fixed, looks like it was Debian repository day today  
15:22 <Trefex> ok tweeted  
15:22 <vmassol> yep seen it  
15:22 <vmassol> thanks  
15:22 <Trefex> https://twitter.com/Trefex/status/697787753203965952  
15:23 <vmassol> so you're a markdown user inside xwiki?  
15:23 <vmassol> (retwitted)  
15:23 <Trefex> wow  
15:24 <Trefex> except that you guys over-wrote my logo  
15:24 <Trefex> it seems i'm running 8.0-M1 now  
15:24 <Trefex> vmassol: yes of course, every page we write is in Markdown  
15:24 <Trefex> it's the most portable language for doc  
15:25 <vmassol> cool to see we have MD users  
15:25 <vmassol> I don't think we have that many  
15:25 <vmassol> and happy to see that it seems to work  
15:25 <vmassol> I coded it but I haven't used it myself yet ;)  
15:25 <vmassol> I know there are some limitations…  
15:26 <Trefex> it works, just rendering is slow at times  
15:26 <vmassol> hmm not much we can do here I guess since that's the parser we use probably  
15:26 <Trefex> vmassol: did you ever fix sectional editing ?  
15:26 <Trefex> for markdown ?  
15:26 <vmassol> nope, doesn't ring a bell  
15:26 <vmassol> (we use pegdown)  
15:27 <Trefex> so it's not fixed  
15:27 <Trefex> or it wasn't broken?  
15:28 <vmassol> no idea  
15:28 <Trefex> 2016-02-11 15:28:20,237 [localhost-startStop-1] WARN  ltInstalledExtensionRepository - Invalid extension [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-statistics-ui-7.3] on namespace [wiki:lcsbml] (InvalidExtensionException: No compatible extension is installed for dependency [org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform-chart-plugin-7.3])  
15:28 <tmortagne> has quit  
15:31 <Trefex> oh yeah, only took 180s to start up the server  
15:31 <Trefex> gotta love Tomcat...  
15:31 <vmassol> Trefex: the warn is ok  
15:31 <vmassol> is that sarcastic or not? :)  
15:32 <vmassol> xwiki is slow to start mostly because there are lots of jars/classes in WEB-INF/lib  
15:32 <vmassol> (FTR)  
15:32 <vmassol> but 3mn is bit too much  
15:50 <Trefex> vmassol: sarcastic yeah  
15:51 <Trefex> upgrade went well, thanks for the assistance :D  
15:51 <vmassol> cool  
15:51 <Trefex> just don't erase my logo the next time  
15:51 <Trefex> you bastards!  
15:51 <vmassol> I don't understand?  
15:51 <vmassol> what logo?  
15:51 <vmassol> oh during th eupgrade  
15:51 <vmassol> ?  
15:51 <Trefex> the logo in the skin  
15:51 <Trefex> ya  
15:51 <vmassol> hmmm  
15:51 <vmassol> that shouldn't happen  
15:52 <vmassol> unless you put on the FS  
15:52 <vmassol> and you overwrite when you copied the new war  
15:52 <Trefex> i don't know what i did  
15:52 <Trefex> no it has a different name i guess  
16:00 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:05 <Trefex> vmassol: how do you put custom logo now in 8.0 ?  
16:05 <Trefex> i guess i did it wrong previously  
16:06 <Trefex> and i have another bug  
16:06 <Trefex> Uncaught Error: Script error for: /xwiki/webjars/xwiki-platform-tree-webjar/7.3/require-config.min.js?evaluate=true  
16:07 <Trefex> i can't see the tree views anymore in the top menu bar when clicking on the arrows  
16:07 <Trefex> sorry, caching issue it seems  
16:07 <vmassol> Trefex: not changed AFAIK: http://enterprise.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/GettingStarted/ChangingTheLogoAndThePanels  
16:25 <tmortagne> has quit  
16:28 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
16:42 <iamchrisf> has joined #xwiki  
16:46 <Trefex> works thanks alot vmassol  
16:46 <vmassol> k  
16:46 <Trefex> still it erased during upgrade :)  
16:50 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:03 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
17:09 <cjd> oh oh xwikibot is back  
17:09 <cjd> OVH LIVES  
17:15 <woshilapin> has quit  
17:16 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
17:37 <benoitc> has quit  
17:40 <ol-ow2> Hi !, $xcontext.myVar doesn't keep a value after a return of form. There is a way to store a var without using BD or save a doc / object ?  
17:41 <benoitc> has joined #xwiki  
17:41 <ol-ow2> also, i don't want passing var in request  
17:42 <ol-ow2> this var must invisible from anybody  
17:43 <tmortagne> ol-ow2: I guess you could store it in the session if it's for the current user session  
17:45 <tmortagne> $request.session gives you the current javax.servlet.http.HttpSession  
17:48 <ol-ow2> and the user will be not able to decrypt this var ?  
17:48 <ol-ow2> tmortagne:  
17:48 <tmortagne> it's a server side data  
17:48 <ol-ow2> ok  
17:49 <ol-ow2> thanks , i will try this way ;) thanks  
17:49 <tmortagne> you're welcome :)  
17:49 <vmassol> ol-ow2: wait, I have a link for you  
17:49 <ol-ow2> ho cool !  
17:49 <vmassol> maybe this could help: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/SavingData  
17:54 <cjd> has quit

19:26 <vmassol> hmmm I think we're missing dates in our release notes on exo  
19:26 <vmassol> ie a user cannot know when a given version was released by looking at the RN section on exo for an extension  
19:26 <vmassol> as a user, I frequently check this info on software I use  
19:30 <vmassol> created http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-13098
